author: Yoko Kubota
title: Baidu Shares Rise on Strong Earnings
text:
Chinese search-engine giant Baidu Inc. beat analyst estimates for its first-quarter sales and profit, buoyed by strong online advertising.
The Beijing-based company reported revenue of 20.9 billion yuan ($3.3 billion) for the period ending March 31, up 31% from the same period a year earlier. That was higher than the average forecast of $3.1 billion, according to analysts polled by S&P Capital IQ.
